title: 109_s1632
content: SPECIAL DEPRECIATION ALLOWANCE for certain property acquired between August 28, 2005, and December 31, 2008. A special allowance of 30% of the adjusted basis of qualified property acquired between August 28, 2005, and December 31, 2008, is provided for in Section 168 of the Internal Revenue Code. This allowance reduces the adjusted basis before computing the depreciation deduction for the taxable year. The special allowance of 30% for qualified property acquired between August 28, 2005, and December 31, 2008, reduces the adjusted basis for depreciation deduction. Qualified property includes property with a recovery period of 20 years or less, water utility property, or computer software meeting specific criteria. The special allowance of 30% applies to qualified property acquired between August 28, 2005, and December 31, 2008, if certain conditions are met, including being placed in service before January 1, 2009. The term 'qualified property' includes property meeting specific requirements, having a recovery period of at least 10 years or being transportation property, subject to section 263A, and meeting additional criteria. The term 'qualified property' includes property meeting specific requirements, having a recovery period of at least 10 years or being transportation property, subject to section 263A, and meeting additional criteria. Property must meet certain requirements under subsection (f)(1)(B) to qualify for additional allowances, with specific conditions for pre-December 31, 2008, basis eligibility and transportation property. The term 'transportation property' refers to tangible personal property used in transporting persons or goods. Exceptions to qualified property include property subject to the alternative depreciation system under subsection (g). The term 'qualified property' excludes qualified leasehold improvement property. Special rules apply to certain property under this subsection. Special rules apply to self-constructed property and sale-leasebacks meeting specific criteria between August 28, 2005, and December 31, 2008. Special rules apply to self-constructed property and sale-leasebacks meeting specific criteria between August 28, 2005, and December 31, 2008. If property is sold and leased back within 3 months after being placed in service, it will be treated as placed in service on the date it is used under the leaseback. For automobiles that are qualified property, the limitation under section 280F will be increased by $4,600. The amendments made by this section apply to property placed in service after August 28, 2005, in taxable years ending after that date.
